title: FOI: impact of changes in master on startup time of datalad commands
body:
#### What is the problem?
 x3-5 time slower for the same command(s):

# install --help
```shell

$> for dld in datalad{,-master,-neuroimaging}; do dl=$dld/venvs/dev/bin/datalad; echo $dl; time $dl install --help | wc -l; done                                                                                           
datalad/venvs/dev/bin/datalad
78
$dl install --help  0.25s user 0.05s system 104% cpu 0.297 total
wc -l  0.00s user 0.00s system 0% cpu 0.297 total
datalad-master/venvs/dev/bin/datalad
78
$dl install --help  0.61s user 0.09s system 100% cpu 0.698 total
wc -l  0.00s user 0.00s system 0% cpu 0.698 total
datalad-neuroimaging/venvs/dev/bin/datalad
78
$dl install --help  0.83s user 0.12s system 99% cpu 0.942 total
wc -l  0.00s user 0.00s system 0% cpu 0.942 total
```

difference washes out a bit while using a real command but still there and might be quite noticeable:

```shell
$> for dld in datalad{,-master,-neuroimaging}; do dl=$dld/venvs/dev/bin/datalad; echo $dl; rm -rf /tmp/123; time $dl install /// /tmp/123 1>/dev/null 2>&1 ; done
datalad/venvs/dev/bin/datalad
$dl install /// /tmp/123 > /dev/null 2>&1  0.31s user 0.09s system 102% cpu 0.390 total
datalad-master/venvs/dev/bin/datalad
$dl install /// /tmp/123 > /dev/null 2>&1  0.50s user 0.12s system 94% cpu 0.651 total
datalad-neuroimaging/venvs/dev/bin/datalad
$dl install /// /tmp/123 > /dev/null 2>&1  0.54s user 0.13s system 76% cpu 0.873 total
```

And for the mighty overall help:

```shell
$> for dld in datalad{,-master,-neuroimaging}; do dl=$dld/venvs/dev/bin/datalad; echo $dl; time $dl --help-np | wc -l; done                                                                                                
datalad/venvs/dev/bin/datalad
167
$dl --help-np  0.26s user 0.06s system 104% cpu 0.314 total
wc -l  0.00s user 0.00s system 0% cpu 0.314 total
datalad-master/venvs/dev/bin/datalad
175
$dl --help-np  0.72s user 0.11s system 100% cpu 0.825 total
wc -l  0.00s user 0.00s system 0% cpu 0.825 total
datalad-neuroimaging/venvs/dev/bin/datalad
180
$dl --help-np  0.74s user 0.15s system 100% cpu 0.886 total
wc -l  0.00s user 0.00s system 0% cpu 0.886 total
```
To react to errorneous command - x1.5-2:
```shell
$> for dld in datalad{,-master,-neuroimaging}; do dl=$dld/venvs/dev/bin/datalad; echo $dl; time $dl bogus 2>&1 | wc -l; done
datalad/venvs/dev/bin/datalad
11
$dl bogus 2>&1  0.35s user 0.10s system 105% cpu 0.425 total
wc -l  0.00s user 0.00s system 0% cpu 0.424 total
datalad-master/venvs/dev/bin/datalad
7
$dl bogus 2>&1  0.65s user 0.09s system 100% cpu 0.735 total
wc -l  0.00s user 0.00s system 0% cpu 0.735 total
datalad-neuroimaging/venvs/dev/bin/datalad
7
$dl bogus 2>&1  0.63s user 0.09s system 100% cpu 0.718 total
wc -l  0.00s user 0.00s system 0% cpu 0.718 total
```

Fortunately impact on the special remote starter is not that sever (well -- up to 2x for -archives one somehow):

```shell
$> for dld in datalad{,-master,-neuroimaging}; do dl=$dld/venvs/dev/bin/git-annex-remote-datalad; echo $dl; time time bash -c "( cd /tmp/123; echo INITREMOTE | $PWD/$dl )" 1>/dev/null 2>/dev/null; done
datalad/venvs/dev/bin/git-annex-remote-datalad
time bash -c "( cd /tmp/123; echo INITREMOTE | $PWD/$dl )" > /dev/null 2>   0.38s user 0.18s system 95% cpu 0.583 total
datalad-master/venvs/dev/bin/git-annex-remote-datalad
time bash -c "( cd /tmp/123; echo INITREMOTE | $PWD/$dl )" > /dev/null 2>   0.62s user 0.16s system 100% cpu 0.774 total
datalad-neuroimaging/venvs/dev/bin/git-annex-remote-datalad
time bash -c "( cd /tmp/123; echo INITREMOTE | $PWD/$dl )" > /dev/null 2>   0.54s user 0.12s system 100% cpu 0.656 total


$> for dld in datalad{,-master,-neuroimaging}; do dl=$dld/venvs/dev/bin/git-annex-remote-datalad-archives; echo $dl; time time bash -c "( cd /tmp/123; echo INITREMOTE | $PWD/$dl )" 1>/dev/null 2>/dev/null; done
datalad/venvs/dev/bin/git-annex-remote-datalad-archives                                                                                                                                           
time bash -c "( cd /tmp/123; echo INITREMOTE | $PWD/$dl )" > /dev/null 2>   0.24s user 0.11s system 105% cpu 0.334 total
datalad-master/venvs/dev/bin/git-annex-remote-datalad-archives
time bash -c "( cd /tmp/123; echo INITREMOTE | $PWD/$dl )" > /dev/null 2>   0.51s user 0.11s system 101% cpu 0.615 total
datalad-neuroimaging/venvs/dev/bin/git-annex-remote-datalad-archives
time bash -c "( cd /tmp/123; echo INITREMOTE | $PWD/$dl )" > /dev/null 2>   0.44s user 0.12s system 101% cpu 0.549 total
```

From running
```shell
(git)smaug:~datalad/datalad-neuroimaging[master]
DATALAD_LOG_LEVEL=2 DATALAD_LOG_TIMESTAMP=1 venvs/dev/bin/datalad --help 2>&1 | ../datalad/tools/dtime 2>&1 | less
```
I see major impact factors (number leading on the line is ms's until the next log line):
```
  268 2018-04-10 10:32:37,130 [Level 5] Importing cmdline.main 
    1 2018-04-10 10:32:37,398 [Level 5] Done importing cmdline.main
  ...
  122 2018-04-10 10:32:37,502 [DEBUG] Loading entrypoint neuroimaging from datalad.extensions 
    2 2018-04-10 10:32:37,624 [Level 5] Importing module datalad.distribution.create
  ...
  251 2018-04-10 10:34:16,543 [DEBUG] Building doc for <class 'datalad.support.sshrun.SSHRun'> 
    5 2018-04-10 10:34:16,794 [DEBUG] Building doc for <class 'datalad_neuroimaging.bids2scidata.BIDS2Scidata'> 
```
It is probably not the actual docbuilding for SSHRun but some import , since in 0.9.x:
```
    1 2018-04-10 10:36:32,929 [DEBUG] Building doc for <class 'datalad.support.sshrun.SSHRun'> 
    2 2018-04-10 10:36:32,930 [Level 5] Importing module datalad.distribution.subdatasets  
```

.... more could be investigated to make it more sensible
